definition: to sign one's name/visa/variant of 籤|签[qian1]
inscribed bamboo stick (used in divination, gambling, drawing lots etc)/small wood sliver/label/tag
strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)

sentences.english: GMO foods do not have to be labeled in America.
sentences.chinese: 在美国，转基因食品毋须用签条标明。

sentences.english: Now please fill out this green label.
sentences.chinese: 现在请填写这个绿色签条。

sentences.english: A large address label was gummed to the package.
sentences.chinese: 包装袋上贴着一大张地址签条。

sentences.english: All archives have labels classified by category, so that it is easier to gather data.
sentences.chinese: 档案上都有按类别划分的签条，查找资料比较容易。

sentences.english: To tag up any surface with paint or ink.
sentences.chinese: 附以签条增加有油漆或墨水的任何表面。

sentences.english: Attach this label to your luggage.
sentences.chinese: 把这个签条系在你的行李上。

sentences.english: Just tag along until you catch up.
sentences.chinese: 仅仅附以签条沿着直到你追赶。

sentences.english: Go ahead and stick a few post-its to the back for marking significant passages, too.
sentences.chinese: 你也可以在重要的内容背面贴便签条来做记号。

sentences.english: Look here. First, drive this stick through the beef.
sentences.chinese: 瞧这儿，首选，用这根签条把牛肉穿起来。

definition: to write the title of a book on a label
manuscript (of a book etc)/sketch (of a design etc)
signature (in grass-style writing)/symbol used in place of a signature (on a document, contract etc)
short comment or critical appraisal added at the end of a text, on a painting etc
seal impression/stamp/mark from a seal serving as signature
authentic (painting or calligraphy)/genuine work (of famous artist)
inscription with name, date, or short sentence, on a painting, gift, letter etc
